required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: OBELIX Study: A Study of Avastin (Bevacizumab) in Combination With XELOX in Patients With Metastatic Cancer of the Colon or Rectum.
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Efficacy and Safety Study of Bevacizumab (Avastin®) in Combination With XELOX (Oxaliplatin Plus Xeloda®) for the First-line Treatment of Patients With Metastatic Cancer of the Colon or Rectum - 'OBELIX'

brief_summary.textblock: This single arm study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of a first-line regimen of Avastin and XELOX (oxaliplatin + Xeloda) in patients with metastatic cancer of the colon or rectum. Patients will receive 21-day cycles of treatment, comprising Avastin 7.5mg/kg iv on day 1, oxaliplatin 130mg/m2 iv on day 1, and Xeloda 1000mg/m2 po twice daily on days 1-14, for a maximum of 6 months. Patients with stable disease or complete or partial response may continue on Avastin therapy. The anticipated time on study treatment is until disease progression, and the target sample size is 100-500 individuals.

primary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Percentage of Participants With Progressive Disease or Death
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 1 of every cycle until disease progression or death up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time period in months from the start of study treatment to the first observation of disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. Data for participants with no tumor assessments after baseline but who were still alive at the time of the clinical cutoff were censored at Day 1. Participants who underwent surgery after experiencing a sufficient shrinkage of the tumor, had any relapse, new occurrence of colorectal cancer, or who died were all considered as having had an event. Participants who underwent surgery without any such event were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment that documented neither a relapse nor a new colorectal cancer had occurred. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0), as a 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 1 of every cycle until disease progression or death up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time period in months from the start of study treatment to the first observation of disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. Data for participants with no tumor assessments after baseline but who were still alive at the time of the clinical cutoff were censored at Day 1. Participants who underwent surgery after experiencing a sufficient shrinkage of the tumor, had any relapse, new occurrence of colorectal cancer, or who died were all considered as having had an event. Participants who underwent surgery without any such event were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment that documented that neither a relapse nor a new colorectal cancer had occurred. Median PFS was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Best Overall Response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) Among Participants in the ITT Population Who Had at Least 1 Post-Baseline Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles) until end of treatment, disease progression, or withdrawal up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with a best overall response of CR or PR according to RECIST. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis less than [<]10 millimeters [mm]). No new lesions. PR was defined as a greater than or equal to (≥) 30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a CR or PR Among Participants in the ITT Population
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles) until end of treatment, disease progression, or withdrawal up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: CR and PR were defined using RECIST v1.0. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to CR or PR Overall Response - Time to Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles) until end of treatment, disease progression, or withdrawal up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to overall response (CR or PR) was calculated as the time between the date of start of treatment until first documented response (CR or PR defined per RECIST v1.0). Participants who did not achieve CR or PR were censored at the date of progression, death, or at last adequate tumor assessment date. Median time to CR or PR overall response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Best Overall Response of CR or PR During First Line Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: CR and PR were defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. Short axis was used in sum for target nodes, while longest diameter was used in sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Overall Response Among Participants Whose Best Response Was CR or PR During First Line Treatment - Time to Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: For participants with a best overall response of CR or PR, the duration of overall response was measured from the time that the criteria for CR or PR (whichever occurred first) was met until the first date that progressive disease was objectively documented or until the date of death due to underlying cancer, whichever occurred first. Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of overall response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Stable Response During First Line Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Stable response defined as participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or stable disease (SD), defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. SD defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter since the treatment started.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: For participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment, the duration of stable response was measured from the time that the criteria for CR, PR, or SD (whichever occurred first) was met until the first date that progressive disease was objectively documented or until the date of death due to underlying cancer, whichever occurred first. Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of stable response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment-failure was defined as discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including the following qualifying events: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Time to treatment-failure was defined as the time from the first day of treatment to discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent). For participants who did not experience a qualifying event, their data were censored at the earlier of either the date of last tumour assessment or the date of the last intake of study medication. Median time to treatment-failure was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival: Percentage of Participants That Died Due to Any Cause
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle to end-of-treatment, every 3 months during longer-term follow-up, or to death due to any cause up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle to end-of-treatment, every 3 months during longer-term follow-up, or to death due to any cause up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive. Median overall survival was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Undergoing Surgical Intervention With Residual Disease Status Post-surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At surgery, at least 6 to 8 weeks after last dose of bevacizumab up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants who underwent surgery during the study period with an evaluation of their disease status after surgery. The surgery during the study period was described by reason: curative, palliative, biopsy, other, or unknown. Residual disease status after surgery was described as: no residual disease due to radical surgery, presence of residual disease, unknown or not applicable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Best Overall Response of CR or PR by Kirsten Rat Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog (K-Ras)/V-Raf Murine Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog B (B-Raf) Mutation Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles) until end of treatment, disease progression, or withdrawal up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with a best overall response of CR or PR according to RECIST. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. The K-Ras and/or the B-Raf gene mutation status of participants was evaluated by the central laboratory using tumor samples. Wild-type participants did not have a mutation in either gene.

secondary_outcome.measure: European Quality of Life 5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Raw-Index Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles), at end-of-treatment up to 5 years
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life (QoL) assessments were used to derive pre-specified QoL scores according to the QoL manual "EQ-5D-3 Level (3L)" user guide for instrument version 4.0. The EQ-5D is a participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The visual analog scale (VAS) component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state. The overall health score absolute changes were calculated for each participant as follows: (score at the end of treatment minus score at baseline). EQ-5D health states were converted into EQ-5D-3L raw index value by applying the scoring algorithm based on the European EQ-net VAS set. The raw index was chosen instead of rescaled index, since the questionnaire was used in order to obtain a quality of life assessment. The raw index scores ranged from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state).

intervention.description: 7.5mg iv on day 1 of each 3 week cycle
130mg/m2 iv on day 1 of each 3 week cycle
1000mg/m2 po bid on days 1-14 of each 3 week cycle

group.title: Bevacizumab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) intravenously (IV) and oxaliplatin 130 mg per square meter (mg/m^2) IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression, participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

baseline.population: Safety population: all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of all study medications.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS): Percentage of Participants With Progressive Disease or Death
outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time period in months from the start of study treatment to the first observation of disease progression or death from any cause, whichever occurred first. Data for participants with no tumor assessments after baseline but who were still alive at the time of the clinical cutoff were censored at Day 1. Participants who underwent surgery after experiencing a sufficient shrinkage of the tumor, had any relapse, new occurrence of colorectal cancer, or who died were all considered as having had an event. Participants who underwent surgery without any such event were censored at the date of the last tumor assessment that documented neither a relapse nor a new colorectal cancer had occurred. Progression is defined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Criteria (RECIST v1.0), as a 20 percent (%) increase in the sum of the longest diameter of target lesions, or a measurable increase in a non-target lesion, or the appearance of new lesions.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and Day 1 of every cycle until disease progression or death up to 5 years
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population: all enrolled participants who received at least 1 dose of all study medications and had at least 1 measurable lesion according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV) and oxaliplatin 130 mg mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population, only those participants who achieved a best overall response of CR or PR during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab

All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. Short axis was used in sum for target nodes, while longest diameter was used in sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions.

outcome.title: Duration of Overall Response Among Participants Whose Best Response Was CR or PR During First Line Treatment - Time to Event
outcome.description: For participants with a best overall response of CR or PR, the duration of overall response was measured from the time that the criteria for CR or PR (whichever occurred first) was met until the first date that progressive disease was objectively documented or until the date of death due to underlying cancer, whichever occurred first. Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of overall response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population, only those participants who achieved a best overall response of CR or PR during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. measure.title: Duration of Overall Response Among Participants Whose Best Response Was CR or PR During First Line Treatment - Time to Event

Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of overall response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
measure.population: ITT population, only those participants who achieved a best overall response of CR or PR during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Stable Response During First Line Treatment
outcome.description: Stable response defined as participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or stable disease (SD), defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. SD defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter since the treatment started.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population, only participants who achieved a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Stable Response During First Line Treatment
measure.description: Stable response defined as participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or stable disease (SD), defined using RECIST v1.0 criteria. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as a ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. SD defined as neither sufficient shrinkage to qualify for partial response nor sufficient increase to qualify for progressive disease, taking as reference the smallest sum longest diameter since the treatment started.
measure.population: ITT population, only participants who achieved a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Duration of Stable Response
outcome.description: For participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment, the duration of stable response was measured from the time that the criteria for CR, PR, or SD (whichever occurred first) was met until the first date that progressive disease was objectively documented or until the date of death due to underlying cancer, whichever occurred first. Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of stable response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population, only participants who achieved a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Duration of Stable Response
measure.description: For participants with a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment, the duration of stable response was measured from the time that the criteria for CR, PR, or SD (whichever occurred first) was met until the first date that progressive disease was objectively documented or until the date of death due to underlying cancer, whichever occurred first. Data for participants who did not have an event or who were alive without an objectively documented progressive disease were censored at the date of last adequate tumor assessment. Median duration of stable response was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
measure.population: ITT population, only participants who achieved a best overall response of CR, PR, or SD during first line treatment were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Treatment-failure was defined as discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including the following qualifying events: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Treatment Failure
measure.description: Treatment-failure was defined as discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including the following qualifying events: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent).

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Time to treatment-failure was defined as the time from the first day of treatment to discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent). For participants who did not experience a qualifying event, their data were censored at the earlier of either the date of last tumour assessment or the date of the last intake of study medication. Median time to treatment-failure was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 3 weeks (every cycle) to disease progression or death up to 5 years

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure
measure.description: Time to treatment-failure was defined as the time from the first day of treatment to discontinuation of treatment for any reason, including: death due to any cause, adverse event, insufficient therapeutic response (progression of disease), failure to return (lost to follow-up), refusing treatment (participant non-compliance), being unwilling to cooperate and withdrawing consent (participant withdrew consent). For participants who did not experience a qualifying event, their data were censored at the earlier of either the date of last tumour assessment or the date of the last intake of study medication. Median time to treatment-failure was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

outcome.title: Overall Survival: Percentage of Participants That Died Due to Any Cause
outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle to end-of-treatment, every 3 months during longer-term follow-up, or to death due to any cause up to 5 years

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Overall Survival: Percentage of Participants That Died Due to Any Cause
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive.

outcome.title: Overall Survival: Time to Event
outcome.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive. Median overall survival was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1 of every cycle to end-of-treatment, every 3 months during longer-term follow-up, or to death due to any cause up to 5 years

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Overall Survival: Time to Event
measure.description: Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the first day of treatment until the date of death from any cause. If a participant was not known to have died, survival was censored at the last date the participant was known to be alive. Median overall survival was estimated using the Kaplan-Meier method.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Undergoing Surgical Intervention With Residual Disease Status Post-surgery
outcome.description: The percentage of participants who underwent surgery during the study period with an evaluation of their disease status after surgery. The surgery during the study period was described by reason: curative, palliative, biopsy, other, or unknown. Residual disease status after surgery was described as: no residual disease due to radical surgery, presence of residual disease, unknown or not applicable.
outcome.time_frame: At surgery, at least 6 to 8 weeks after last dose of bevacizumab up to 5 years
outcome.population: The 52 participant subpopulation of the ITT population who underwent surgery during the time period of the study.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Undergoing Surgical Intervention With Residual Disease Status Post-surgery
measure.description: The percentage of participants who underwent surgery during the study period with an evaluation of their disease status after surgery. The surgery during the study period was described by reason: curative, palliative, biopsy, other, or unknown. Residual disease status after surgery was described as: no residual disease due to radical surgery, presence of residual disease, unknown or not applicable.
measure.population: The 52 participant subpopulation of the ITT population who underwent surgery during the time period of the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Best Overall Response of CR or PR by Kirsten Rat Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog (K-Ras)/V-Raf Murine Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog B (B-Raf) Mutation Status
outcome.description: The percentage of participants with a best overall response of CR or PR according to RECIST. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. The K-Ras and/or the B-Raf gene mutation status of participants was evaluated by the central laboratory using tumor samples. Wild-type participants did not have a mutation in either gene.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles) until end of treatment, disease progression, or withdrawal up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population; only participants with a known K-Ras and/or B-Raf gene mutation status and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment. Number (n) equals (=) number of participants with either wild-type or K-Ras/B-Raf gene mutation.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Best Overall Response of CR or PR by Kirsten Rat Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog (K-Ras)/V-Raf Murine Sarcoma Viral Oncogene Homolog B (B-Raf) Mutation Status
measure.description: The percentage of participants with a best overall response of CR or PR according to RECIST. CR was defined as complete disappearance of all target lesions and non-target disease, with the exception of nodal disease. All nodes, both target and non-target, must have decreased to normal (short axis <10 mm). No new lesions. PR was defined as ≥30% decrease under baseline of the sum of diameters of all target lesions. The short axis was used in the sum for target nodes, while the longest diameter was used in the sum for all other target lesions. No unequivocal progression of non-target disease. No new lesions. The K-Ras and/or the B-Raf gene mutation status of participants was evaluated by the central laboratory using tumor samples. Wild-type participants did not have a mutation in either gene.
measure.population: ITT population; only participants with a known K-Ras and/or B-Raf gene mutation status and at least 1 post-baseline tumor assessment. Number (n) equals (=) number of participants with either wild-type or K-Ras/B-Raf gene mutation.

outcome.title: European Quality of Life 5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Raw-Index Score
outcome.description: Quality of life (QoL) assessments were used to derive pre-specified QoL scores according to the QoL manual “EQ-5D-3 Level (3L)" user guide for instrument version 4.0. The EQ-5D is a participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The visual analog scale (VAS) component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state. The overall health score absolute changes were calculated for each participant as follows: (score at the end of treatment minus score at baseline). EQ-5D health states were converted into EQ-5D-3L raw index value by applying the scoring algorithm based on the European EQ-net VAS set. The raw index was chosen instead of rescaled index, since the questionnaire was used in order to obtain a quality of life assessment. The raw index scores ranged from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 9 weeks (every 3 cycles), at end-of-treatment up to 5 years
outcome.population: ITT population, only participants who had EQ-5D-3L scores for both baseline and last visit were included in the analysis.

group.title: Bevucizamab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV and oxaliplatin 130 mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

measure.title: European Quality of Life 5 Dimension (EQ-5D) Raw-Index Score
measure.description: Quality of life (QoL) assessments were used to derive pre-specified QoL scores according to the QoL manual “EQ-5D-3 Level (3L)" user guide for instrument version 4.0. The EQ-5D is a participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single index value. The visual analog scale (VAS) component rates current health state on a scale from 0 (worst imaginable health state) to 100 (best imaginable health state); higher scores indicate a better health state. The overall health score absolute changes were calculated for each participant as follows: (score at the end of treatment minus score at baseline). EQ-5D health states were converted into EQ-5D-3L raw index value by applying the scoring algorithm based on the European EQ-net VAS set. The raw index was chosen instead of rescaled index, since the questionnaire was used in order to obtain a quality of life assessment. The raw index scores ranged from 0 (worst health state) to 100 (best health state).
measure.population: ITT population, only participants who had EQ-5D-3L scores for both baseline and last visit were included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: Change from baseline to last visit

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AE) were collected from the date of first administration of study treatment until 28 days after the last dose of study treatment up to 5 years

group.title: Bevacizumab+Oxaliplatin+Capecitabine/Bevacizumab
group.description: Cycles 1-8 (3-week cycles): Participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV) and oxaliplatin 130 mg mg/m^2 IV on Day 1 and capecitabine 1000 mg/m^2 tablets, orally, every 12 hours starting the evening of Day 1 for 14 days continuously; cycle was repeated until disease progression or for a maximum of 8 cycles. Cycle 9 and beyond (3-week cycles): If the first 8 cycles were tolerated with no disease progression, participants received bevacizumab 7.5 mg/kg IV on Day 1; the cycle was repeated until disease progression.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request the Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
